property.name: hbase.rootdir
property.description: The directory shared by region servers. Should be fully-qualified to include the filesystem to use. E.g: hdfs://NAMENODE_SERVER:PORT/HBASE_ROOTDIR

property.name: hbase.master.port
property.description: The port master should bind to.

property.name: hbase.cluster.distributed
property.description: The mode the cluster will be in. Possible values are false: standalone and pseudo-distributed setups with managed Zookeeper true: fully-distributed with unmanaged Zookeeper Quorum (see hbase-env.sh)

property.name: hbase.tmp.dir
property.description: Temporary directory on the local filesystem.

property.name: hbase.master.info.port
property.description: The port for the hbase master web UI Set to -1 if you do not want the info server to run.

property.name: hbase.master.info.bindAddress
property.description: The address for the hbase master web UI

property.name: hbase.client.write.buffer
property.description: Size of the write buffer in bytes. A bigger buffer takes more memory -- on both the client and server side since server instantiates the passed write buffer to process it -- but reduces the number of RPC. For an estimate of server-side memory-used, evaluate hbase.client.write.buffer * hbase.regionserver.handler.count

property.name: hbase.master.meta.thread.rescanfrequency
property.description: How long the HMaster sleeps (in milliseconds) between scans of the root and meta tables.

property.name: hbase.master.lease.period
property.description: HMaster server lease period in milliseconds. Default is 120 seconds. Region servers must report in within this period else they are considered dead. On loaded cluster, may need to up this period.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.port
property.description: The port an HBase region server binds to.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.info.port
property.description: The port for the hbase regionserver web UI Set to -1 if you do not want the info server to run.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.info.port.auto
property.description: Info server auto port bind. Enables automatic port search if hbase.regionserver.info.port is already in use. Useful for testing, turned off by default.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.info.bindAddress
property.description: The address for the hbase regionserver web UI

property.name: hbase.regionserver.class
property.description: An interface that is assignable to HRegionInterface. Used in HClient for opening proxy to remote region server.

property.name: hbase.client.pause
property.description: General client pause value. Used mostly as value to wait before running a retry of a failed get, region lookup, etc.

property.name: hbase.client.retries.number
property.description: Maximum retries. Used as maximum for all retryable operations such as fetching of the root region from root region server, getting a cell's value, starting a row update, etc. Default: 10.

property.name: hbase.client.scanner.caching
property.description: Number of rows that will be fetched when calling next on a scanner if it is not served from memory. Higher caching values will enable faster scanners but will eat up more memory and some calls of next may take longer and longer times when the cache is empty.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.lease.period
property.description: HRegion server lease period in milliseconds. Default is 60 seconds. Clients must report in within this period else they are considered dead.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.handler.count
property.description: Count of RPC Server instances spun up on RegionServers Same property is used by the HMaster for count of master handlers. Default is 10.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.msginterval
property.description: Interval between messages from the RegionServer to HMaster in milliseconds. Default is 3 seconds.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.flushlogentries
property.description: Sync the HLog to the HDFS when it has accumulated this many entries. Default 100. Value is checked on every HLog.append

property.name: hbase.regionserver.optionallogflushinterval
property.description: Sync the HLog to the HDFS after this interval if it has not accumulated enough entries to trigger a sync. Default 10 seconds. Units: milliseconds.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.logroll.period
property.description: Period at which we will roll the commit log.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.thread.splitcompactcheckfrequency
property.description: How often a region server runs the split/compaction check.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.nbreservationblocks
property.description: The number of reservation blocks which are used to prevent unstable region servers caused by an OOME.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.dns.interface
property.description: The name of the Network Interface from which a ZooKeeper server should report its IP address.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.dns.nameserver
property.description: The host name or IP address of the name server (DNS) which a ZooKeeper server should use to determine the host name used by the master for communication and display purposes.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.dns.interface
property.description: The name of the Network Interface from which a region server should report its IP address.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.dns.nameserver
property.description: The host name or IP address of the name server (DNS) which a region server should use to determine the host name used by the master for communication and display purposes.

property.name: hbase.master.dns.interface
property.description: The name of the Network Interface from which a master should report its IP address.

property.name: hbase.master.dns.nameserver
property.description: The host name or IP address of the name server (DNS) which a master should use to determine the host name used for communication and display purposes.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.upperLimit
property.description: Maximum size of all memstores in a region server before new updates are blocked and flushes are forced. Defaults to 40% of heap

property.name: hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.lowerLimit
property.description: When memstores are being forced to flush to make room in memory, keep flushing until we hit this mark. Defaults to 30% of heap. This value equal to hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.upperLimit causes the minimum possible flushing to occur when updates are blocked due to memstore limiting.

property.name: hbase.hbasemaster.maxregionopen
property.description: Period to wait for a region open. If regionserver takes longer than this interval, assign to a new regionserver.

property.name: hbase.regions.percheckin
property.description: Maximum number of regions that can be assigned in a single go to a region server.

property.name: hbase.server.thread.wakefrequency
property.description: Time to sleep in between searches for work (in milliseconds). Used as sleep interval by service threads such as META scanner and log roller.

property.name: hbase.hregion.memstore.flush.size
property.description: Memstore will be flushed to disk if size of the memstore exceeds this number of bytes. Value is checked by a thread that runs every hbase.server.thread.wakefrequency.

property.name: hbase.hregion.memstore.block.multiplier
property.description: Block updates if memstore has hbase.hregion.block.memstore time hbase.hregion.flush.size bytes. Useful preventing runaway memstore during spikes in update traffic. Without an upper-bound, memstore fills such that when it flushes the resultant flush files take a long time to compact or split, or worse, we OOME.

property.name: hbase.hregion.max.filesize
property.description: Maximum HStoreFile size. If any one of a column families' HStoreFiles has grown to exceed this value, the hosting HRegion is split in two. Default: 256M.

property.name: hbase.hstore.compactionThreshold
property.description:
If more than this number of HStoreFiles in any one HStore (one HStoreFile is written per flush of memstore) then a compaction is run to rewrite all HStoreFiles files as one. Larger numbers put off compaction but when it runs, it takes longer to complete. During a compaction, updates cannot be flushed to disk. Long compactions require memory sufficient to carry the logging of all updates across the duration of the compaction.
If too large, clients timeout during compaction.

property.name: hbase.hstore.blockingStoreFiles
property.description: If more than this number of StoreFiles in any one Store (one StoreFile is written per flush of MemStore) then updates are blocked for this HRegion until a compaction is completed, or until hbase.hstore.blockingWaitTime has been exceeded.

property.name: hbase.hstore.blockingWaitTime
property.description: The time an HRegion will block updates for after hitting the StoreFile limit defined by hbase.hstore.blockingStoreFiles. After this time has elapsed, the HRegion will stop blocking updates even if a compaction has not been completed. Default: 90 seconds.

property.name: hbase.hstore.compaction.max
property.description: Max number of HStoreFiles to compact per 'minor' compaction.

property.name: hbase.hregion.majorcompaction
property.description: The time (in miliseconds) between 'major' compactions of all HStoreFiles in a region. Default: 1 day.

property.name: hbase.regions.slop
property.description: Rebalance if regionserver has average + (average * slop) regions. Default is 10% slop.

property.name: hfile.min.blocksize.size
property.description: Minimum store file block size. The smaller you make this, the bigger your index and the less you fetch on a random-access. Set size down if you have small cells and want faster random-access of individual cells.

property.name: hfile.block.cache.size
property.description: Percentage of maximum heap (-Xmx setting) to allocate to block cache used by HFile/StoreFile. Default of 0.2 means allocate 20%. Set to 0 to disable.

property.name: hbase.hstore.blockCache.blockSize
property.description: The size of each block in the block cache. Enable blockcaching on a per column family basis; see the BLOCKCACHE setting in HColumnDescriptor. Blocks are kept in a java Soft Reference cache so are let go when high pressure on memory. Block caching is not enabled by default.

property.name: hbase.hash.type
property.description: The hashing algorithm for use in HashFunction. Two values are supported now: murmur (MurmurHash) and jenkins (JenkinsHash).

property.name: zookeeper.session.timeout
property.description: ZooKeeper session timeout. This option is not used by HBase directly, it is for the internals of ZooKeeper. HBase merely passes it in whenever a connection is established to ZooKeeper. It is used by ZooKeeper for hearbeats. In milliseconds.

property.name: zookeeper.retries
property.description: How many times to retry connections to ZooKeeper. Used for reading/writing root region location, checking/writing out of safe mode. Used together with ${zookeeper.pause} in an exponential backoff fashion when making queries to ZooKeeper.

property.name: zookeeper.pause
property.description: Sleep time between retries to ZooKeeper. In milliseconds. Used together with ${zookeeper.retries} in an exponential backoff fashion when making queries to ZooKeeper.

property.name: zookeeper.znode.parent
property.description: Root ZNode for HBase in ZooKeeper. All of HBase's ZooKeeper files that are configured with a relative path will go under this node. By default, all of HBase's ZooKeeper file path are configured with a relative path, so they will all go under this directory unless changed.

property.name: zookeeper.znode.rootserver
property.description: Path to ZNode holding root region location. This is written by the master and read by clients and region servers. If a relative path is given, the parent folder will be ${zookeeper.znode.parent}. By default, this means the root location is stored at /hbase/root-region-server.

property.name: zookeeper.znode.safemode
property.description: Path to ephemeral ZNode signifying cluster is out of safe mode. This is created by the master when scanning is done. Clients wait for this node before querying the cluster. If a relative path is given, the parent folder will be ${zookeeper.znode.parent}. By default, this means the safe mode flag is stored at /hbase/safe-mode.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: Comma separated list of servers in the ZooKeeper Quorum. For example, "host1.mydomain.com,host2.mydomain.com,host3.mydomain.com". By default this is set to localhost for local and pseudo-distributed modes of operation. For a fully-distributed setup, this should be set to a full list of ZooKeeper quorum servers. If HBASE_MANAGES_ZK is set in hbase-env.sh this is the list of servers which we will start/stop ZooKeeper on.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.peerport
property.description: Port used by ZooKeeper peers to talk to each other. See http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/r3.1.1/zookeeperStarted.html#sc_RunningReplicatedZooKeeper for more information.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.leaderport
property.description: Port used by ZooKeeper for leader election. See http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/r3.1.1/zookeeperStarted.html#sc_RunningReplicatedZooKeeper for more information.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.property.tickTime
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The number of milliseconds of each tick.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.property.initLimit
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The number of ticks that the initial synchronization phase can take.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.property.syncLimit
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The number of ticks that can pass between sending a request and getting an acknowledgment.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.property.dataDir
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The directory where the snapshot is stored.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.property.clientPort
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The port at which the clients will connect.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.property.maxClientCnxns
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. Limit on number of concurrent connections (at the socket level) that a single client, identified by IP address, may make to a single member of the ZooKeeper ensemble. Set high to avoid zk connection issues running standalone and pseudo-distributed.
